com.topcoder.util.file.templatesource
Interface TemplateSource

All Known Implementing Classes:
FileTemplateSource
public interface TemplateSource

This interface abstracts a template source, some kind of repository where templates can be retrieved from, based on a given name.

The name has different interpretations specific to each implementation (the value of a field in the database source, a file name in the file source, a file name in a future CVS source implementation).

All implementations must implement a public constructor accepting an ID and a ConfigurationObject instance. - as it is needed by the dynamic instantiation performed in DocumentGenerator.

Thread-safety: Implementations are required to be thread-safe.

Since:
2.1
Version:
3.0
Author:
adic, roma, ShindouHikaru, biotrail, gniuxiao, TCSDEVELOPER

Method Detail

getTemplate

java.lang.String getTemplate(java.lang.String templateName)
                             throws TemplateSourceException
Retrieves the text of the template with the given name.

Parameters:
templateName - the name of the template
Returns:
the text of the template
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null or empty
TemplateSourceException - indicates an error while retrieving the template:
  • there isn't a template with the given name
  • wraps some implementation specific exception (SQL exception, I/O exception)
Since:
2.0

addTemplate

void addTemplate(java.lang.String templateName,
                 java.lang.String templateText)
                 throws TemplateSourceException
Adds the template to the template source with the given name. If there is a template with that name, it is replaced.

Parameters:
templateName - the name of the template
templateText - the text of the template
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null or empty
TemplateSourceException - indicates an error while adding the template:
  • wraps some implementation specific exception (SQL exception, I/O exception)
Since:
2.0

removeTemplate

void removeTemplate(java.lang.String templateName)
                    throws TemplateSourceException
Removes the template with the given name from the template source.

Parameters:
templateName - the name of the template
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null or empty
TemplateSourceException - indicates an error while removing the template:
  • there isn't a template with the given name
  • wraps some implementation specific exception (SQL exception, I/O exception)
Since:
2.0
